SENT.plain: The assessment is presented of 160 patients with ischaemic stroke from the point of view of gender, selected risk factors, incidence of internal carotid thrombosis (ICT) and age
The material was divided into three age groups: up to 49 years, 50-69 years and 70 years and above
A significant prevalence of men was noted in both younger age groups
With progressing age atrial fibrillation was found significantly more frequently while the number of patients with ICT was decreasing
Similarly, the number of smokers and patients with raised hematocrit value was decreasing
The most frequent risk factor for ischaemic was hypertension
Obesity and diabetes were not significantly changing in relation to age in their prevalence in this material
